intro: Cymopterus megacephalus, commonly known as the giant false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are often clustered together, and its leaves are typically pinnately divided with a distinctive hairy texture. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
